other_tests.findings: All 17 patients had functional visual fields, with 82% having tubular fields and 71% exhibiting nonphysiologic constriction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In 8 of 11 patients who had FVL at initial presentation, findings stabilized with persistent nonphysiologic visual fields. 1 patient showed improvement, while 2 patientsâ€™ findings worsened.

other_tests.findings: Performed on 5 patients with evidence of functional visual loss. Some exhibited progressive loss on follow-up visual field testing.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 1 patient showed progressive loss post-surgery, while another had resolution of IIH but suffered a recurrence with new visual field loss.

other_tests.findings: Opened at pressure of 35 cm, normal brain magnetic resonance venography results.
